 No, you'd still be pro-choice. 
 
 At a policy meeting that I went to in Montreal, a group of young Liberals debated whether or not marijuana should be legalized in Canada.
 
 The conclusion was that although the decision to smoke marijuana was the individuals choice where doing so did not intrude on other's choice of a smoke-free environment, it should not be legalized for complex economic reasons. 
 
 So I'd liken your reasoning that a woman has a right to choose to abort, but not a right to legal recognition of that right, to the reasoning of the young Liberals that a person has a right to choose to smoke, but not a right to legal recognition of that right. 
 
 Pro-choice is a moral position, not a legal one.
